validation_note: The input data is accurate. Multiple studies confirm that CDC7 directly phosphorylates TDP-43 at serines 409/410, a key pathological modification. This phosphorylation enhances TDP-43 toxicity, and inhibiting CDC7 is neuroprotective in various models.

functions.cellular_process: Cell division cycle 7 (CDC7) kinase directly phosphorylates TDP-43 at pathological serine residues 409 and 410. This post-translational modification is a hallmark of TDP-43 proteinopathies like ALS and FTLD-TDP.
functions.effect_description: Phosphorylation of TDP-43 by CDC7 promotes its aggregation and neurotoxicity. Consequently, inhibition of CDC7 kinase activity has been shown to reduce TDP-43 phosphorylation and protect against neurodegeneration in cell culture and animal models, identifying CDC7 as a potential therapeutic target.
biological_consequence: CDC7 kinase activation → Direct phosphorylation of TDP-43 at S409/S410 → Promotion of TDP-43 aggregation and cytoplasmic mislocalization → Enhanced TDP-43 neurotoxicity → Neurodegeneration
specific_effects: Purified human CDC7 directly phosphorylates recombinant TDP-43 at serines 409/410 in vitro.
Inhibition of CDC7 with small molecules reduces TDP-43 phosphorylation in human cell cultures and C. elegans models.
Inhibition of CDC7 prevents TDP-43-dependent neurodegeneration in C. elegans and mouse models of ALS.
CDC7 co-localizes with phosphorylated TDP-43 pathology in the frontal cortex of FTLD-TDP patients.

evidence.paper_title: CDC7 inhibition blocks pathological TDP-43 phosphorylation and neurodegeneration
evidence.relevant_quote: We show CDC7 robustly phosphorylates TDP-43 at pathological residues S409/410 in C. elegans, in vitro, and in human cell culture.
evidence.authors: Liachko NF, McMillan PJ, Guthrie CR, Strovas TJ, Magnuson DS, Kravitz S, Kraemer BC

evidence.paper_title: Targeting nuclear protein TDP-43 by cell division cycle kinase 7 inhibitors: A new therapeutic approach for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
evidence.relevant_quote: Among the kinases involved in these changes, cell division cycle kinase 7 (CDC7) plays an important role by directly phosphorylating TDP-43.
evidence.authors: Martínez-González L, Salado IG, V-G de Ganuza D, de la Torre C, Gil C, Campillo NE, Martínez A

evidence.paper_title: Regulation of TDP-43 phosphorylation in aging and disease
evidence.relevant_quote: To date, five kinases have been shown to directly phosphorylate TDP-43: casein kinases 1 and 2 (CK1 and CK2), cell division cycle 7 (CDC7), and tau tubulin kinases 1 and 2 (TTBK1 and TTBK2).
evidence.authors: Koga S, Liachko NF, Kasanuki K, Po-Yen Chen A, Cook CN, Dickson DW, Kraemer BC

mechanism: Cell division cycle 7 (CDC7) kinase directly phosphorylates TDP-43 at pathological serine residues 409 and 410. This post-translational modification is a hallmark of TDP-43 proteinopathies like ALS and FTLD-TDP.
effect: Phosphorylation of TDP-43 by CDC7 promotes its aggregation and neurotoxicity. Consequently, inhibition of CDC7 kinase activity has been shown to reduce TDP-43 phosphorylation and protect against neurodegeneration in cell culture and animal models, identifying CDC7 as a potential therapeutic target.
summary: TDP43 activates CDC7 to modulate tdp-43 phosphorylation, ultimately affecting neurodegeneration.

evidence.relevant_quote: We show CDC7 robustly phosphorylates TDP-43 at pathological residues S409/410 in C. elegans, in vitro, and in human cell culture.
